resources.string: "A shattered glass bottle can potentially start a wildfire with help from the sun, which can develop into a forest fire. \n\nMake sure to always take your garbage home with you!"

"When using a disposable grill you should always make sure that it is placed on an even and non-flammable surface. \n\nMake sure that it is properly put out, and always dispose of it in a container specifically made for disposable grills."

"Did you know that lightning is the cause of a lot of forest fires in Norway every year? It can also linger in the ground for three days before igniting. \n\nAlways CALL 110 if you witness any sign of fire!"

"Using tools that has an open flame can be very dangerous. It is important to take precautions when dealing with these kind of tools. \n\nAlways make an assessment before using them, and if there is a high danger index, postpone it!"
"Make sure that you always use a container specifically made for disposable grills when you are done using it. \n\nYou can often find a useful map of these on official websites."

"It is prohibited to light a fire, bbq og disposable grill in, or in close range of, the forest from the 15. April to the 15. September. \n\nWhen lightning a fire you should always make sure to properly put it out before leaving."

"\nThe numbers indicating the danger index are provided by The Norwegian Meteorological Institute, and are calculated with regards to rainfall, humidity and temperature. \nIt is important to be extra cautious when the index signals a high risk."
Low danger 0 to 30. Medium danger 31 to 60. High danger over 60
slide to the right to include warning for lower danger index
This application requires internet access to function. Please make sure you have an internet connection and try again.
Descriptive image filling top of page
